metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1296 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The UnescapeURLWithAdjustmentsImpl implementation in net/base/escape.cc in Google Chrome before 45.0.2454.85 does not prevent display of Unicode LOCK characters in the omnibox, which makes it easier for remote attackers to spoof the SSL lock icon by placing one of these characters at the end of a URL, as demonstrated by the omnibox in localizations for right-to-left languages.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1296` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-browser-l10n - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-chromedriver - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
No subscription required
